intro: Lissochilus katentaniensis, commonly known as the Katentani bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
